etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal of Science. From German Pachnolith from ancient Greek πάχνη hoar frost (from the base of πηγνύναι to fix, make solid + suffix forming nouns) + German -lith

definitions: A hydrated fluoride of aluminium, calcium, and sodium, NaCaAlF₆ ·H₂ O, occurring as small white monoclinic crystals on cryolite.
